remixlab.proscene
Class DesktopEvents

java.lang.Object
  remixlab.proscene.DesktopEvents
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener
public class DesktopEvents
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener

This class provides low level java.awt.* based input event handling.

In order to handle input events generated by Processing with proscene, this object needs to be registered at the PApplet (which is done through Scene.enableKeyboardHandling() and Scene.enableMouseHandling()). Input events (keyboard and mouse) generated via Processing will then be directed to keyEvent(KeyEvent) and to mouseEvent(MouseEvent).

Method Detail

keyEvent

public void keyEvent(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
Keyboard event handler.

See Also:
Scene.keyboardIsHandled(), Scene.enableKeyboardHandling(boolean)

keyTyped

protected void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
Implementation of the key typed event used to handle character shortcuts.

The handler queries the Scene.currentCameraProfile() to see if there's a binding there first. If nothing is found, the handler look for it in the Scene then.

See Also:
keyTypedCameraKeyboardAction(KeyEvent), keyTypedKeyboardAction(KeyEvent)

keyReleased

protected void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
Implementation of the key released event used to handle complex shortcuts, i.e., shortcuts involving a keycode plus a modifier mask.

The handler looks for a possible binding in the Scene.currentCameraProfile() first. If the Scene.currentCameraProfile() doesn't bind an action, the handler searches for it in the Scene.

See Also:
keyReleasedCameraKeyboardAction(KeyEvent), keyReleasedKeyboardAction(KeyEvent)

keyTypedCameraKeyboardAction

protected boolean keyTypedCameraKeyboardAction(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
Internal use.

This method extracts the character associated with the key from the KeyEvent and then queries the Scene.currentCameraProfile() to see if there's a binding for it.

Returns:
true if a binding was found

keyTypedKeyboardAction

protected boolean keyTypedKeyboardAction(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
Internal use.

This method extracts the character associated with the key from the KeyEvent and then queries the Scene to see if there's a binding for it.

Returns:
true if a binding was found

keyReleasedCameraKeyboardAction

protected boolean keyReleasedCameraKeyboardAction(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
Internal use.

This method extracts the key combination (keycode + modifier mask) associated with the KeyEvent and then queries the Scene.currentCameraProfile() to see if there's a binding for it.

Returns:
true if a binding was found

keyReleasedKeyboardAction

protected boolean keyReleasedKeyboardAction(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
Internal use.

This method extracts the key combination (keycode + modifier mask) associated with the KeyEvent and then queries the Scene to see if there's a binding for it.

Returns:
true if a binding was found

getButton

protected Scene.Button getButton(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
Internal use.

Utility function that gets the Scene.Button from this MouseEvent.

mouseEvent

public void mouseEvent(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
Mouse event handler.

See Also:
Scene.mouseIsHandled(), Scene.enableMouseHandling(boolean)

mouseClicked

protected void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event)
The action generated when the user clicks the mouse is handled by the Scene.mouseGrabber() (if any). Otherwise looks in the Scene.currentCameraProfile() to see if there's a binding for this click event, taking into account the button, the modifier mask, and the number of clicks.

mouseMoved

public void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
Scene.setMouseGrabber(MouseGrabbable) to the MouseGrabber that grabs the mouse (or to null if none of them grab it).

mousePressed

public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
The action generated when the user clicks and drags the mouse is handled by the Scene.mouseGrabber() (if any), or the Scene.interactiveFrame() (if @link remixlab.proscene.Scene#interactiveFrameIsDrawn()), or the Scene.camera() (checks are performed in that order).

Mouse displacements are interpreted according to the Scene.currentCameraProfile() mouse bindings.

See Also:
mouseDragged(MouseEvent), mouseReleased(MouseEvent), mouseWheelMoved(MouseWheelEvent)

mouseDragged

public void mouseDragged(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
The mouse dragged event is sent to the Scene.mouseGrabber() or the Scene.interactiveFrame(), or to the Scene.camera(), according to the action started at mousePressed(MouseEvent).

Mouse displacements are interpreted according to the Scene.currentCameraProfile() mouse bindings.

See Also:
mousePressed(MouseEvent), mouseReleased(MouseEvent)

mouseReleased

public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
The mouse released event (which ends a mouse action) is sent to the Scene.mouseGrabber() or the Scene.interactiveFrame(), or to the Scene.camera(), according to the action started at mousePressed(MouseEvent).

Mouse displacements are interpreted according to the Scene.currentCameraProfile() mouse bindings.

See Also:
mousePressed(MouseEvent), mouseDragged(MouseEvent)

mouseWheelMoved

public void mouseWheelMoved(java.awt.event.MouseWheelEvent event)
The action generated when the user start rotating the mouse wheel is handled by the Scene.mouseGrabber() (if any), or the Scene.interactiveFrame() (if @link remixlab.proscene.Scene#interactiveFrameIsDrawn()), or the Scene.camera() (checks are performed in that order).

Mouse wheel rotation is interpreted according to the Scene.currentCameraProfile() mouse wheel bindings.

Specified by:
mouseWheelMoved in interface java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener
See Also:
mousePressed(MouseEvent)
